Absolutely amazing! 

It starts off a little slow, especially if you've already played Narbacular Drop or played with the portal gun in Garry's Mod. After the intro levels, the puzzle action really gets interesting, and you start getting sucked into the game quite a bit. 

The story is pretty simple, but there is a ton of character, a few surprises, and a great ending. Plus, even after you finish the game, there are bonus levels and challenge modes to keep you coming back for more!

Good:
+ Snarky AI
+ Perfect length
+ Interdimensional portals
+ Smart puzzles

Bad:
- Companion cube :(

Portal is revered as a puzzling classic for good reason, the portal mechanics are revolutionary and totally change the way one sees the game's 3D spaces. Pair that with a well-written narrative and you have a great game.

[b]Portal[/b] is approaching its tenth anniversary, but continues to hold up excellently.  Indeed, in some ways, it's even better now; [b]Portal[/b] jokes and references are not nearly as ubiquitous as they where a few years ago, making it easier to go into this game without its best moments feeling tired.

At its heart, [b]Portal[/b] is a puzzle game, and any such game faces a balancing act.  The puzzles must be hard enough that solving them is satisfying, but not so much that you quit in frustration.  [b]Portal[/b] threads that particular needle expertly.  Sure, the first couple of puzzles really are easy, but after that you get an expertly pitched difficulty curve.  New elements are added at just the right rate, building to a highly satisfying conclusion.

Of course, what made [b]Portal[/b] as famous as it is is its brilliant humour.  If you're unfamiliar with all the jokes and memes that sprang from here, then welcome, youngster, you should immediately play this game.  But even if you've heard those quotes and quips, that shouldn't put you off.  For one thing, there's so much humour packed in here, you probably won't know it all.  For another, don't you want to know the context? 

[b]Portal[/b] is ultimately just excellent.  Unless you have an aversion to the first-person perspective or otherwise are physically unable, you owe it to yourself to play this game.
I don't know why I always postponed playing this masterpiece. I regret not installing and playing this game earlier.

Bastante entretenido y recomendado. Será corto pero engancha. El precio es justo y durante el juego tienes una muy simpática compañera que no te deja solo, y lo más importante, hace que el viaje por este mini universo sea menos denso y más divertido.
Los puzzles no son la gran cosa pero el punto principal del juego para mí es como se desarrolla GLaDOS, siendo una máquina pre-programada, si se le altera una pequeña parte de ella no sabe que hacer.
En resumen, gran juego que vale la pena por el precio, aunque recomiendo comprarlo en ofertas. Recomendadísimo.

Portal will really make you think, fire your neurons, flip your burgers, toast your bread, and rattle your bones.
Also accompanied with some of the best comedy writing in a video game to date.

[h1]Summary[/h1]

Portal is a first person puzzle game where you have a portal gun that allows you to create binary portals. You can only have two portals at the time and if you enter one portal you exit through the other portal. The main objective is to escape a set of test chambers under the supervision the AI computer GlaDOS. For that you will need to take advantage of the portal gun. It's an interesting concept and the story does not disappoint.

+ Great concept
+ Interesting puzzles
+ Very good atmosphere
+ Interesting story
- Kind of short

[h1]Review[/h1]

This is one of those games that explains itself inside the game. There is no tutorial or introduction. This makes you want to explore the game and perhaps know more about the background story. As soon as you make your first steps you will be introduced by GlaDOS which will invite you to complete a few tests.

To solve the puzzles you will have to master the portal gun. A fully featured portal gun allows you to shoot two portals, a blue and a orange one. You can only have one each at a time. This allows, for example, to shoot a portal at a far spot and another at the near spot, making to move great distances instantaneously. You can also get to high ground or take advantage of your fall speed to jump very high. It's a very powerful tool.

The puzzles are very well designed. These never feel too easy or too hard and often leave you with satisfaction of having completion. You will have to get to though spots using the portal gun, lock buttons with cubes and avoid android with a built-in machine guns.

The story of the game itself is very intriguing, GlaDOS seems to honestly want to you to complete the puzzles but at the same time seems like you're just another test subject. The test chambers are not fully covered and often you will get to parts that shouldn't be there, making you wonder what's going on. As the game goes on both these characteristics will only intensify. For me it never felt bored.

Unfortunately the game is small but after you beat the game you have advanced puzzles and challenges. The advanced puzzles are more difficult puzzles than the ones in the main game and the challenge are puzzles with limits such as time or steps. It's a nice addition.

If you like puzzle games and this sort of story this is a must have.

Juego Excelente, tiene algunos acertijos interesantes para resolver. 

Pros:
-Historia interesante
-Acertijos
-Lugares/frases interesantes escondidas en los niveles

Contras:
-Acertijos no muy dificiles, son buenos pero realmente no son muy complicados de resolver.
-Corto, a mi parecer extremadamente corto, en 4hs lo terminas
-Pocos niveles, estaría bueno que traiga mas niveles extras para resolver cuando terminas la historia

En resumen, es un juego interesante para probar si te interesa jugar con las fisicas y mecanicas de los portales, la historia es interesante pero corta, una experiencia que no debes perderte.
